intro: Fittonia albivenis, commonly known as the nerve plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, veined leaves that range from bright green to red. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Fittonia albivenis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its striking foliage and ease of care.
